author: Fredrik Strand Oseberg
description:
I vividly remember my first 6 months trying to learn to program. I was following
along with a tutorial of some sort, not understanding anything of what I was
doing. I was basically a copy cat. The video in front of me would often go too fast for my typing. And too many
times I had to stop the vid…
title: Mistakes I Made When Learning to Code – and How to Avoid Them

author: Sarah Chima Atuonwu
description: CSS specificity is an important topic to understand if you want to get better at CSS. It is the set of rules applied to CSS selectors that determines which style is applied to an element.
title: CSS Specificity and When to Use the CSS Important Tag

description:
> “To understand recursion, one must first understand recursion” - Unknown

you read about it. For me, it was because 1. recursion is a hard concept in itself, and 2. some of the tutorials and articles I read weren’t…
title: How to Understand Recursion in JavaScript

author: Kris Koishigawa
description:
If you’ve ever seen the .xml extension in your downloads folder and wondered
what that is, you’re not alone. Keep reading to learn what and XML file is, and how to open it both locally on
your computer and in online editors. What’s an XML file?
XML stands for Extensible Markup Language and was cre…
title: What is an XML File? How to Open XML Files and the Best XML Viewers

author: Markus Hatvan
description:
You might not be aware of it, but you use some form of open source software
every single day. Every time you start an app on your phone or launch a program on your computer,
you profit from the code that someone has written for free. WordPress, the largest and most well-known content management sy…

author: Marcia Villalba
description:
Static sites can host all kinds of websites from your personal portfolio, to a
company landing page, or even a blog. The main advantage of static sites is that they are simple to manage. They are
also very cost-efficient. And with static sites, you don’t need complex content

title: How to Host a Static Site in the Cloud in Four Steps

author: Jesse Hall
description: Logging messages to the console is a very basic way to diagnose and troubleshoot minor issues in your code. But, did you know that there is more to console than just log? In this article I’ll show you all of the things you didn’t know console could do.
title: JavaScript Console.log() Example – How to Print to the Console in JS

author: Manish Shivanandhan
description: Penetration testing is the process of exploiting an organization’s network to help defend it better. Here are five steps involved in a successful penetration test.
title: The Ethical Hacking Lifecycle — Five Stages Of A Penetration Test

description:

3D games. But you can also use it to build 2D games. We just released a full 3-hour Unreal Engine course on the freeCodeCamp.org

description:

description:
Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps. It’s a popular
library for managing state in React apps. Redux can offer a better developer experience when you use it along with
TypeScript. TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that type-checks code to make
it robust and understandabl…

description:
Agile is a methodology for approaching software development. It consists of
different frameworks such as SCRUM or Kanban that help development teams
continuously build, test, and gather feedback on their product. Agile consists of four core principles: 1. Individuals and interactions over proces…

description: Rsync (Remote Synchronization) is a fast, versatile, remote (and local) file transfer tool. In this article, we will look at how to work with rsync.

author: Catalin Pit
description:

strings in JavaScript. In simpler words, we can use placeholders to inject variables into a string. You
can see an example of string interpolation using template literals in the
snippet below: const age = 4.5;
const …
title: JavaScript String Format – How to use String Interpolation in JS

description:
Would you like to know how to predict the future with a simple formula and some

future. But we’re going to look into the theory of how we could do it with the
formula Y = a + b * X. After we cover the theory we’re goi…
title: The Least Squares Regression Method – How to Find the Line of Best Fit

author: Beau Carnes
description:

so they can access it later. freeCodeCamp.org just released a full 3-hour video course that will introduce

title: Data Structures Explained – Learn Computer Science Concepts in This 3 Hour Tutorial

author: John Mosesman
description:
The GROUP BY clause is a powerful but sometimes tricky statement to think about. Even eight years later, every time I use a GROUP BY I have to stop and think
about what it’s actually doing. In this article we’ll look at how to construct a GROUP BY clause, what it does
to your query, and how you ca…
title: SQL Group By Tutorial: Count, Sum, Average, and Having Clauses Explained

description:

you into someone you don’t want to be. After more than 12 years as a software developer, I’ve grown some habits that
I’m…

description: Increased usage of these open source libraries has provided tremendous productivity benefits. However, it also comes with disadvantages - namely in relation to security.
title: The Best Application Security Tools in 2020

few more considerations to cover. TLS, or Transport Layer Security, refers to a prot…
title: What is TLS? Transport Layer Security Encryption Explained in Plain English

author: Alexander Arobelidze
description:
The unit circle is a useful visualization tool for learning about trigonometric

different values and allows the user to simply derive different results for
